AD_Combat_AnimatingSpores_02.synopsis: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is using Animating Spores spell.

AD_Combat_AnimatingSpores_03.synopsis: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is using Animating Spores spell.

individual_metadata.synopsis: Main dialogue with creepy myconid sovereign. He wants you to kill some duergar that are left from when they attacked these mushroom creatures. Myconids are part of a "circle", kind of a hive mind. They speak in visions, with music - all telepathically. This should be otherworldly and slightly disturbing.

AD_Combat_AnimatingSpores_01.synopsis: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is using Animating Spores spell.

AD_Combat.synopsis: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is taking his turn.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: There appear to be two sets of ordering constraints in the provided sessions. First, three combat sessions for the Animating Spores (named with suffixes _01, _02, and _03) suggest a sequential progression – the numbering implies that _01 should come before _02, which in turn should come before _03. Second, the main dialogue session (identified by the empty key) involves the myconid sovereign speaking telepathically and giving a directive. Logically, this dialogue would occur before the combat encounters (both the regular AD_Combat and the ones with Animating Spores) since the sovereign’s speech sets up the conflict. Therefore, the main dialogue should come before the combat encounters. Note that while the “AD_Combat” session appears to be a separate combat encounter for when the sovereign takes his own turn, it too would generally be reached after the dialogue. There are no clear indications from the summaries that any sessions are mutually exclusive (i.e. that one path precludes another), so no exclusivity constraints have been added.

86.speaker: Narrator
86.text: *Hums. Clicks. Harmonies. They drift through you like an unknown language.*

158.speaker: Narrator
158.text: *Then, visions. Dark dwarves - duergar - chopping fungal tendrils with their axes.*

152.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
152.text: ((*the dark intruders broke our peace. they killed our young*))

64.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
64.text: ((*we laid waste to many. others remain*))

107.speaker: Narrator
107.text: *You see another vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
107.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vision can be a simple linear pose to pose transition, portraying a single action

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Why did these duergar attack you?

89.speaker: Narrator
89.text: *Deep purples swirl into familiar shapes: gnomes in mining gear chased by duergar.*

169.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
169.text: ((*the duergar seek a gnome. it is a guest*))

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Conjure tranquil memories in hopes of calming the sovereign.

92.speaker: Narrator
92.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*

192.speaker: Narrator
192.text: *The sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but insistent.*

142.speaker: Narrator
142.text: *The sovereign's song halts as it measures your might.*

145.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
145.text: ((*I will reward. you cleanse the Rot. you destroy them*))

79.speaker: Player
79.text: THREATEN ME AGAIN. I DARE YOU.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: Do you truly wish to do battle with a great warrior?

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *The sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but insistent.*

98.speaker: Player
98.text: Kneel in submission. I mean no harm to you.

106.speaker: Narrator
106.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, poking you, warning you...*

38.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
38.text: ((*vile beast. cure the Rot. end it*))

108.speaker: Player
108.text: Hum a peaceful tune in harmony with the sovereign.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: The Underdark is my home. I do not need your permission to be here.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: I know the value of clan. Let me enter, so I may help yours.

170.speaker: Player
170.text: I will not be intimidated! Attack.

87.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
87.text: ((*Glut's song had grown sour and stifling. it was a mercy to end it*))

96.speaker: Narrator
96.text: *It greets you with a harrowing elegy, cheerless as the new moon.*

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I'll cleanse the rot. Those duergar near the lake will die.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: The duergar attacked you in those visions - why?

101.speaker: Player
101.text: The duergar are slain; the rot has been purged.

6.speaker: Narrator
6.text: *The music shifts - still melancholic, but now streaked with hope.*

174.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
174.text: ((*do you hear, Kin Spirit? a new harmony. serenity. I now deem you Peace-Bringer*))

61.speaker: Narrator
61.text: *Fragrant spores waft through the air. Your heart swells with bliss with your every breath.*
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: The myconid sovereign releases spores into the air. They fill you with blissful joy.

55.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
55.text: ((*freely you have given to us. freely you may take*))

190.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
190.text: ((*the guardian gate is open already. but perhaps there is still some reward to claim*))
190.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of wall of vines, already opened by player

184.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
184.text: ((*the guardian gate is open. go and claim your reward*))
184.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of vines unfurling from the reward chamber.

161.speaker: Sovereign Glut
161.text: ((*so generous is Spaw, mighty Sovereign. but when I sang my need, I received only silence*))
161.context: NodeContext: Scornful and furious - Glut received no such generosity when he came begging for help. Now he wants revenge.

4.speaker: Sovereign Glut
4.text: ((*you give us nothing. we will take everything*))

196.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
196.context: NodeContext: Shocked, looking to player for an explanation

37.speaker: Player
37.text: You named me poorly, Spaw. I bring you death.

149.speaker: Player
149.text: I wanted you to hear Glut's treachery first-hand. Now let's end it.

90.speaker: Sovereign Glut
90.text: ((*traitor. your corpse will know no rest. you will rise only to die again*))
90.context: NodeContext: Vicious - he thought the player was in on his murder plot only to be exposed

97.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
97.text: ((*but before this, I have another boon to ask of you. you have cut out the duergar blight - but not its source*))

77.speaker: Narrator
77.text: *In your mind's eye, Spaw shows you a drow, striding among myconid dead.*

35.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
35.text: ((*Nere, this one is called. he hunted us - hunt him in turn. bring me his head, and I will know my Circle is safe*))

200.speaker: Lae'zel
200.text: Do you see? Indulge one demand, and it only breeds another.
200.context: NodeContext: Irritated - this is where our helping gets us

180.speaker: Shadowheart
180.text: More busywork? That's royalty for you - everyone's their servant.

3.speaker: Karlach
3.text: This Nere sounds like bad news. I guess we could lend a hand, right?

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Nere is dead, but his head is lost to me.

179.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
179.text: ((*then the Circle is safe, if you speak true. Peace-Bringer, our alliance comes to an end*))

156.speaker: Player
156.text: Consider it done. I will bring Nere's head to you.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: There'll be another reward for this, I hope.

29.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
29.text: ((*I ask a boon, and will give one in return*))

48.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
48.text: ((*the drow lurks in the ruins beyond the lake. bring him death, and return*))

100.speaker: Player
100.text: You're racking up quite the body count.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I think I've had enough of running your errands.

44.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
44.text: ((*I can only ask, and reward in return. if your path takes you to the ruins beyond the lake, you will find the drow*))

5.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
5.text: ((*from there, your choices are your own*))

147.speaker: Astarion
147.text: I'm more than happy to kill this - whoever he is, but tell me there's something in it for us?

57.speaker: Wyll
57.text: Always another evil to correct, always another monster to slay.
57.context: NodeContext: A little weary, but shrugging and getting on with it

28.speaker: Gale
28.text: My, but this sovereign likes to delegate.

199.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
199.text: ((*do you hear? a new harmony. serenity. I name you Peace-Bringer*))

33.speaker: Player
33.text: What in the hells did you do to that corpse?

124.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
124.text: ((*we breathe life into our enemies' flesh*))

73.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
73.text: ((*the dead make a fine host for my growing children*))

164.speaker: Shadowheart
164.text: If I die down here, destroy my corpse.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: These spores hold such power. How might I gain this knowledge?

165.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
165.text: ((*you may not. the spores hear only the Circle. they dance to no other harmony*))

197.speaker: Player
197.text: The spore-magic is repulsive. You die by my hand!

202.speaker: Player
202.text: Duergar, reduced to cadaverous puppets? You will die by my hand!

66.speaker: Player
66.text: You planted animating spores in the corpse, yes?

183.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
183.text: ((*yes. our enemies' flesh makes a fine host for my growing children*))

194.speaker: Player
194.text: Planting spores in a corpse - what magic is this?

122.speaker: Narrator
122.text: *The sovereign's thick fingers stroke the corpse at its feet. A droning melody greets you as the creature turns its gaze to you.*
122.context: CinematicNodeContext: The sovereign is messing with a corpse in some way as you approach. It rises.

160.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
160.text: ((*flesh-talker. I show you a memory. watch and listen*))

138.speaker: Narrator
138.text: *A violent vision grips you: duergar - dark dwarves - chopping myconid remains.*
138.context: CinematicNodeContext: A vision can be a simple pose with a linear transition, portraying a simple action

31.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
31.text: ((*they broke our peace. they killed our young*))

45.speaker: Narrator
45.text: *The sovereign's song slows to the pace of a dirge. It is still in mourning.*

198.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
198.text: ((*we laid waste to many. but intruders remain. lakeward*))

134.speaker: Narrator
134.text: *The sovereign's song halts as it measures your worth.*

84.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
84.text: ((*I sense your resolve. you will find duergar invaders near lake's edge. cleanse the Rot. destroy them*))

70.speaker: Lae'zel
70.text: Let us spill blood. Duergar or myconid - I care not which.

93.speaker: Shadowheart
93.text: Duergar invaders? We can manage that - better than picking this fight, surely.
93.context: NodeContext: 'I'd rather fight three grey dwarves later than this fungus monster right now'

68.speaker: Karlach
68.text: Duergar invaders, huh? I'd like to hear their side of the story first, but all right.

132.speaker: Narrator
132.text: *Deep purples swirl into familiar shapes: gnomes in mining gear chased by duergar.*

178.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
178.text: ((*the duergar seek a gnome. it is a guest*))

67.speaker: Player
67.text: You harbour a fugitive gnome? Admirable of you.

175.speaker: Narrator
175.text: *The sovereign says nothing, but you hear appreciation in its song.*

148.speaker: Player
148.text: Sure, I can handle those duergar nearby.

53.speaker: Narrator
53.text: *An illusion comes over you: a duergar, choking on a cloud of gleaming dust.*
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vision can be a simple pose linear transitioning to another, portraying a simple action

115.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
115.text: ((*accept this gift. it will help you exterminate*))
115.context: CinematicNodeContext: Myconid offers you a vial of spores to help you kill the duergar

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *The sovereign gifts you one more vision: a wall of vines parting to reveal glowing light.*

172.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
172.text: ((*riches of magic and mind. cleanse the Rot, and they are yours*))

166.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
166.text: ((*you do the Circle a service. we will await word*))

203.speaker: Player
203.text: No duergar is 'rot'! Attack the sovereign.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Forget it. If you want them dead, you can kill them yourself.

133.speaker: Narrator
133.text: *It replies with an echoing screech, and returns its gaze to the corpse.*
133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sovereign screeches, but we should not show the manipulation scene with the corpse any longer.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: They betrayed you by breaking the peace. I will break their bodies for you.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Reply in kind. ((*tell me of the invaders. how the scourge moves, fights. how it will crumble*))

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: *The sovereign's song twists into images: duergar changing size. Slipping in and out of invisibility. Invoking craven divinity.*

129.speaker: Player
129.text: Imitate the sovereign and lie. ((*good tidings. the scourge is defeated. you are safe*))

109.speaker: Narrator
109.text: *The sovereign probes your mind. Valiant, but untrue, images of you slaying duergar greet it. The myconid retreats, satisfied.*

185.speaker: Astarion
185.text: I admit, I like this one's approach. A little genocidal, but effective.

99.speaker: Wyll
99.text: Duergar killed their children. They should pay the price for the cruelty.

143.speaker: Gale
143.text: I suppose such wicked killers deserve wicked ends.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: I have slain the creature called Glut. It was scheming to slaughter your circle.

19.speaker: Narrator
19.text: *You are one with Spaw. Your throat tightens, then relaxes. The air is serene, your mind untroubled.*

43.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
43.text: ((*and I sense only silence from the duergar hunters - the Rot is cleansed*))

2.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
2.text: ((*the songs we sing now carry your spirit. I first named you Peace-Bringer. I now name you Kin Spirit*))

130.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
130.text: ((*you aid us twice over. so twice I will thank you*))

32.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
32.text: ((*the songs we sing now carry your spirit. you shall now be called Kin Spirit*))

186.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
186.text: ((*you aid us in good faith. in good faith, I thank you*))

14.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
14.text: ((*the drow sought to shatter our Circle. now his flesh may feed its growth*))

110.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
110.text: ((*in dealing death, you have brought this Circle life. and thus we name you - Life-Chanter*))
110.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Sovereign waves his hand and iridescent spores release, surrounding, exalting the player.

205.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
205.text: ((*as our Circle grows, so shall your song. wherever you go, only listen - and you may hear it*))

76.speaker: Player
76.text: You named me poorly, Spaw. Glut is sovereign now - and I bring you death.
76.context: InternalNodeContext: Player agreed to kill Spaw for Glut, but Glut's confrontation never triggered for any reason.

80.speaker: Sovereign Glut
80.text: ((*I will scatter you throughout the dark places, Spaw. your corpse will never know home*))

155.speaker: Player
155.text: You named me poorly, Spaw. Glut is sovereign now - and I bring you death.
155.context: InternalNodeContext: Player agreed to kill Spaw for Glut, but Glut's confrontation never triggered for any reason.

201.speaker: Narrator
201.text: *Whispers. Moans. Disharmony. They drift through you like an unknown language.*

0.speaker: Narrator
0.text: *Then, you see visions. Dark dwarves - duergar - chopping myconid remains with their axes.*

150.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
150.text: ((*they broke our peace. they killed our young*))

46.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
46.text: ((*we laid waste to many. you bring yet another. you bring us the Rot*))

140.speaker: Narrator
140.text: *You see another vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
140.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vision can be a simple linear pose to pose transition, portraying a single action

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Conjure tranquil memories in hopes of calming the sovereign.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: Kneel in submission. My duergar companion means no harm to you.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Do you truly wish to do battle with a great warrior?
